messages.message:
Hi team, attempting to pull an image from our GCR.io (http://GCR.io) repo results in me receiving the following error, even though I’ve been able to successfully pull containers in the past —

`failed to copy: httpReadSeeker: failed open: unexpected status code` https://gcr.io/v2/instabase-public/celery-core-tasks/blobs/sha256:8047b96c08ce16deab2afbb3d0971cf88c0b335e57b3b0a76cf0d1f584ae5af0`: 401 Unauthorized`

I’ve re-signed into gcloud auth with my Instabase account, but have kept running into the same error.

Is this an error anyone's experienced before? Why would our google repo give me a 401 error?
I also get the same error. Maybe check if the URL is correct?

Looks like it should be correct?

gcr.io/instabase-public/celery-app-tasks:23.01.25-d34e3ed880 (http://gcr.io/instabase-public/celery-app-tasks:23.01.25-d34e3ed880) is the image I'm pulling

interesting that you get the same error

I double checked your permissions, you have access to images in instabase-public as with everyone else in the div-customer-engineering group. Can you try a different image to see if another one works?
Will do; running `docker pull gcr.io/instabase-public/celery-core-tasks:23.01.25-d34e3ed880 (http://gcr.io/instabase-public/celery-core-tasks:23.01.25-d34e3ed880)` to see if that fails as well.
